conversion_verification.notes: Second image shows an angled cutaway/isometric-like view with extruded walls (height + thickness) and visible interior volumes; ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with thickness, readable floor-vs-wall separation, good interior volume perception, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification at some corners/joins and uniform wall heights/materials reduce realism but not 3D validity.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall 2B/2T layout is preserved (living/dining central, bedrooms left/right, kitchen/utility lower-left, decks at top-left and top-right, toilet near top-center). However, multiple dimension/proportion inconsistencies are visible (e.g., living/dining and kitchen labels/dimensions differ from 2D plan), and some wall lengths/room extents appear stretched/shifted relative to the 2D drawing.

interior_elements.notes: Beds and living furniture present; kitchen counters shown; toilets/fixtures present but simplified. Some rooms (utility/bath areas) appear under-detailed and furniture is more schematic than plan-specific.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is generally readable with decent lighting and contrast. However, heavy room text/measure labels on surfaces reduce presentation clarity, and openings (doors/windows) are not consistently legible.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable proportion/dimension deviations between the 2D plan and 3D render (e.g., living/dining and kitchen dimension labels differ; some room extents appear resized).
Doors/windows/openings are not consistently represented with clear placement and swing/orientation fidelity compared to the 2D plan.
Room labels/dimensions rendered on the 3D model surfaces clutter the presentation and reduce visual clarity points.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with broadly correct room arrangement, but with noticeable proportion/dimension drift and incomplete/unclear door-window fidelity.
